intro: Gymnolomia quitensis, commonly known as the Peruvian daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in the cool, temperate climates of the Andes. Its foliage is usually basal, with narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh mountain conditions. Gymnolomia quitensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated for its delicate, daisy-like blooms.
